chapters.title: Introduction to Investing
chapters.text: Investing is the act of purchasing an item (asset) with the hope that over time the asset will appreciate value, and then be sold for a profit at a higher price.

chapters.title: Relevance
chapters.text: Investing is a key aspect of financial literacy. Value of money can depreciate over time even if we don't actually lose money due to inflation. Therefore, consistent, disciplined, investing is a great way to grow one's wealth and tackle inflation.

chapters.title: Example
chapters.text: Jacob just got to college and wants to start trading stocks. He has $500 right when he opens his first account to start buying and selling stocks. He buys 1 share of Netflix at $200 and 2 shares of Sony at $150 each. Within that first month of trading a share of Netflix went up to $230 and a share of Sony went up to $215. Jacob made $160 in his first month of trading with $500 to start.
